title: 107_hr344
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act by amending certain sections and eliminating defined terms. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 amends sections of the Social Security Act related to insured status and widow's insurance benefits based on disability. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 amends sections of the Social Security Act related to insured status and widower's insurance benefits based on disability. Amendments include the elimination of defined terms and changes to the eligibility criteria for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 amends the Social Security Act to change eligibility criteria for disability benefits. Section 202(f) is amended to eliminate a defined term and redesignate paragraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate waiting periods for disability and Medicare benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for specified benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for specified benefits. This includes adjustments to the entitlement criteria for Medicare coverage, such as removing the 24-month waiting period and updating the language regarding entitlement duration. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for specified benefits. This involves adjustments to Medicare coverage criteria, such as eliminating the 24-month waiting period and updating language on entitlement duration for the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATES. The amendments made by this Act apply to Social Security benefits based on disability under specific sections of the Social Security Act, with effective dates starting from the third month after enactment. The amendments in this Act apply to disability benefits under the Social Security Act, with effective dates starting from the third month after enactment for some sections and 90 days after enactment for others.
